title.narrative: Provision of immediate assistance to conflict-affected populations in under-served and hard to reach areas of Iraq (Tel Afar district, Ninewa Governorate).

description.narrative:
The FRC and Iraqi Red Crescent Society (IRCS) proposal is designed to scale-up the immediate response to identified humanitarian needs, gaps and constraints linked with the current operations to retake Mosul, Tel Afar and Ninewa governorate. Lots of conflict-affected populations have fled the area of combat and many more are expected to flee the ISIL controlled-territories or to be trapped in the areas of combat. The rationale for this intervention is based on the fact that authorities are overstretched and under-resourced, undermining their ability to respond to urgent critical needs. In addition, the volatility of the situation and the difficulty to access violence prone areas make difficult the provision of an immediate response by humanitarian actors.
This analysis led the IRCS and FRC to design a project aiming at filing the gaps of the humanitarian assistance, as a first line responder, addressing the basic needs of the newly IDPs and host communities (1800 HHs) by pre positioning and distributing standardized non food item kits in hard to reach locations, Tel Afar sub-district through a Rapid Response Mechanism (72h).This action will be the opportunity to strengthen the operational capacity of IRCS to provide an emergency response to large scale disasters.
The response must also be planned with a high degree of flexibility and the project locations may have to be revised to take into account sudden or unforeseen population movements of the IDPs.
Direct beneficiaries will be newly IDPs and host communities in hard to reach areas, in need not covered by humanitarian assistance because of security issues and/or geographical constraints. Beneficiaries will be targeted through an identification process built on vulnerability needs and coordinated humanitarian assistance system. The project aims at providing NFI assistance to an estimated 1800 households, particularly women, children, the elderly and the most vulnerable families. Assistance will help newly-displaced and accessible persons as well as existing vulnerable population in hard-to-reach areas to meet their immediate needs.
